Cable, phone, or utility bill (dated within 60 days)
Statement, bill, or record from a health institution
Insurance bill, statement, or record (homeowner's, life, renter's, automobile, health insurance; dated within 60 days)
Banking, financial or credit card account bill, statement or notice (dated within 60 days)
Letter from New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA) (dated within 60 days)
Letter from NYC Administration for Children Services foster care agency (dated within 60 days)
Letter from homeless shelter in NYC (must state applicant has stayed at the shelter for 15 days and shelter allows residents to remain for more than 30 days)

Letter from residential care facility operated, certified, or funded by NYS Office for People with Developmental Disabilities (OPWDD), NYS Department of Health (NYS DOH), or NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (NYC DOHMH)
Notice of Decision or Determination of Developmental Disability issued by NYS Office for People with Developmental Disabilities (OPWDD) and proof of residency for the applicant and caretaker
Residency Confirmation Letter for United Nations (UN) Diplomats and Their Families
Letter from principal or designee of the principal of a Head Start, Early Learn, or any NYC DOE school where applicant's child is enrolled (dated within 60 days)

Letter from a principal or designee of the principal of a private or parochial school where applicant or applicant's child is a currently enrolled student (for students and their parent/guardian; dated within 60 days)
Current residential property lease or sublease
Local property tax statement (dated within 1 year)
Property mortgage payment receipt (dated within 60 days)
NYCHA Lease Addendum and Rent Notice
United States Postal Service (USPS) Change of Address confirmation (dated within 60 days)
NYC Housing Preservation and Development (HPD) Section 8 Rent Breakdown Form
NYS DMV Interim Driver's License, Learner's Permit, or Non-Driver's Identification card. Also, 2 points of ID, including, DOB
NYS Office of Mental Health (OMH) Facility Inpatient Photo ID card. Also 1 point of ID, including photo ID
Employment pay stub (dated within 60 days)
IRS Forms W-2, 1099-MISC, 1095-A, 1095-B, and 1095-C (accepted through April 15 of the year following the tax year on the form)
Letter or document issued by the U.S. Internal Revenue Service (IRS), or the NYS Department of Taxation and Finance (DTF) (dated within 1 year)
Tax return with proof of filing (dated within 1 year of filing date)
Jury summons or court order Issued by NYS (including NYC Courts) or federal court (dated within 60 days)
HRA "Response to Request for a Budget Calculation Report" (dated within 60 days)
DOE Student Verification Form issued by DOE schools (this document is not yet available, please check back for updates)
Summer Youth Employment Program Verification Form
"Verification of Release" form issued by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, Office of Refugee Resettlement, Division of Children's Services
U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) Order of Supervision (dated within 1 year)

residency.type: No Stable Address/Survivors of Domestic Violence

documents.document: Care-of Letter Issued by nonprofit organization or religious institution in NYC serving homeless individuals or survivors of domestic violence. Entity must currently receive City funding. Letter must indicate applicant has received services from the entity for past 60 days and may use entity's address for mailing purposes (dated within 14 days). Address on card will be "Care Of" the organization
Letter from City agency, nonprofit organization, or religious institution in NYC that provides services to individuals without a home address (dated within 30 days). No address to appear on card

Letter from City agency, nonprofit organization, or religious institution in NYC that provides services to survivors of domestic violence (dated within 30 days). No address or P.O. Box to appear on card
Letter Issued by a hospital or health Clinic in NYC (dated within 30 days)
